required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Multiple Ascending Dose Study of BMS-844203 (CT-322) Monotherapy in Japanese Patients With Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of CT-322 monotherapy to determine the recommended dose for phase II and subsequent studies

primary_outcome.measure: Determine recommended dose for Phase 2 study of CT-322

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the plasma pharmacokinetics of CT-322. Pharmacokinetics of CT-322 will be derived from plasma concentration versus time data. The pharmacokinetic parameters to be assessed include Cmax, Cmin, Tmax, AUC (INF), AUC (TAU), T-HALF, etc.

To assess the plasma pharmacokinetics of CT-322. Pharmacokinetics of CT-322 will be derived from plasma concentration versus time data. The pharmacokinetic parameters to be assessed include Cmax, Cmin, Tmax, AUC (INF), AUC (TAU), T-HALF, etc.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 2 and beyond (up to 6 cycle): Day 1 at each cycle and then every 3 cycles thereafter

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess anti-tumor activity of CT-322
To assess the effects of CT-322 on plasma VEGF levels
To assess the effects of CT-322 on plasma VEGF levels
To assess the presence of anti CT-322 antibodies
To assess the presence of anti CT-322 antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 3 and beyond (up to 6 cycle): Day 1 at each cycle and then every 3 cycles thereafter

intervention.description: Injection, IV, 1 and 2 mg/kg, Weekly, Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity became apparent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced or metastatic solid tumors for whom the standard of care is ineffective or inappropriate
- Life expectancy of at least 3 months
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has uncontrolled diabetes or hypertension
- Clinical significant bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy
- Thrombotic or embolic cerebrovascular accident

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm
